alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Greater Greenville; Greater Oconee; Greater Pickens; Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 11:14PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Greenville, northwestern Spartanburg, northern Anderson, central Pickens and southeastern Oconee Counties through midnight EST... At 1114 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Clemson to 4 miles south of Seneca to 11 miles southeast of Toccoa. Movement was northeast at 80 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Easley, Clemson, Pickens, Seneca, Anderson, Greer and Mauldin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Greater Greenville; Greater Oconee; Greater Pickens; Spartanburg
